items.title: Exponent Energy's battery data intelligence will power its new EV financing push in India
items.summary: The tech company believes real-time energy usage and financial data can help underwrite loans more precisely, mitigating risks in the highly challenging commercial EV three-wheeler segment.

items.title: AI integration can help manage complexities in power sector: IEA expert
items.summary: India's power industry is on the brink of transformation, and artificial intelligence will be at the forefront of this change. As the proportion of renewable energy surges, managing the complexities of the electricity system will become vital. AI can enhance our ability to predict solar and wind power generation, utilizing continuous real-time analysis.

items.title: Fractal Analytics share price jumps nearly 6% after PL Capital's 'Buy' rating, 40% upside forecast
items.summary: Fractal Analytics shares rose nearly 6% on February 17 after Prabhudas Lilladhar (PL) recommended a 'Buy' with a target price of  ₹1,260, indicating a 40% upside. Shares opened at  ₹826.25 on BSE and  ₹847.15 on NSE, reflecting a weak debut.

items.title: IT stocks recover 2% today as investors buy on dips after a 21% drop from peak: Experts suggest top tech stocks to buy
items.summary: The Nifty IT index gained over 2% on February 17, recovering from a recent slump. Brokerages are optimistic about selective investments in companies like TCS and Persistent Systems, despite fears of AI disruption and competitive pressures in the IT sector.

items.title: IT stocks oversold, capital markets remain a structural story: Nitin Raheja
items.summary: Nitin Raheja of Julius Baer believes the IT sector selloff is overdone, with AI disruption unfolding gradually. He sees strong cash flows enabling IT firms to invest in AI acquisitions and data centers. Raheja also highlights India's low household equity allocation as a long-term growth driver for capital markets, favoring asset managers for now.

items.title: Dinesh Kumar Khara says RBI’s new guidelines balance customer protection and growth
items.summary: New RBI regulations will significantly alter how banks sell financial products, fund acquisitions, and lend to market intermediaries. Former SBI Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara believes these moves, particularly stricter mis-selling norms and revised M&A financing rules, aim to enhance customer trust and domestic market development.

items.title: Weather extremes continue to hit saffron production despite revival push in J&K
items.summary: Agriculture experts say saffron is highly climate-sensitive, particularly during the flowering window, when untimely rain, drought-like conditions, or temperature anomalies can severely affect stigma formation and flower yield

items.title: US Market | Disruption vs Returns: The tug-of-war driving AI market volatility
items.summary: Global markets are experiencing turbulence as investors weigh the immense potential of AI against the massive costs of its development. While AI's disruptive power across industries is undeniable, the timeline for significant returns on colossal investments remains uncertain. This duality is fueling market volatility, prompting a cautious approach as the AI revolution unfolds.

items.title: IT stocks attempt to get back on their feet. What Nomura, UBS and Citi are saying
items.summary: Information technology stocks rebounded after a steep two-week selloff, with Infosys, TCS and Wipro rising up to 3%. Investor concerns over AI-driven disruption eased slightly, even as brokerages warned that advances in agentic AI could challenge traditional IT services models. Analysts, however, see scope for business-model evolution and selective opportunities.

items.title: Reliance-backed Zivame bets on India's small cities with fresh store blitz, COO says
items.summary: Zivame is focusing ⁠on India’s tier-2 and tier-3 cities for its next phase of growth, where demand is increasingly mirroring that of metro ​markets as social media ‌accelerates adoption, says COO Kiruba Devi

items.title: Crude oil futures trade lower as markets await US-Iran talks
items.summary: At 9.58 am on Tuesday, February crude oil futures were trading at ₹5,764 on MCX during the initial hour of trading on Tuesday against the previous close of ₹5791, down by 0.47%

items.title: Why 'real' has become Gen Z’s most valuable currency
items.summary: India's Gen Z prioritizes authenticity, favoring relatable creators over celebrities and scripted ads. They trust lived experiences and personal connections, making niche brands appealing if they resonate with identity.  Credibility stems from believability and verifiable experiences, with AR tools enhancing trust.  For brands, being 'real' is the essential standard for this value-conscious generation.

items.summary: OpenAI has hired the Austrian creator of OpenClaw, an artificial intelligence tool able to execute real-world tasks

items.summary: Meanwhile, the dollar index, which gauges the greenback's strength against a basket of six currencies, was trading 0.23% higher at 97.14

items.summary: US tech giants are facing a sharp valuation reset in 2026 as investors question whether massive AI spending can deliver adequate returns. Stocks like Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia and Alphabet have fallen, while firms with stronger earnings visibility, such as TSMC and Samsung, have gained, signalling a shift in market sentiment.

items.title: Alibaba unveils new Qwen3.5 model for 'agentic AI era'
items.summary: The release comes as Alibaba looks ⁠to attract more users to its Qwen chatbot app in China, a landscape currently dominated by rival tech giant ByteDance’s Doubao and DeepSeek

items.summary: Infosys shares rose on Tuesday after the IT major announced a strategic partnership with AI firm Anthropic to build enterprise-ready AI solutions. The collaboration will integrate Claude models with Infosys Topaz to automate workflows, boost software development and scale AI adoption across sectors, lifting investor sentiment and the stock price.

items.title: SBI’s 70% rally narrows valuation gap with HDFC Bank, ICICI — buy, hold or book profits?
items.summary: State Bank of India's (SBI) stock has surged nearly 70% in the past year, narrowing its valuation gap with private sector giants like HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank. Experts suggest SBI is now fairly valued, with strong fundamentals and earnings visibility supporting its current price, though further significant upside may be limited.

items.title: Rupee rises 1 paisa to 90.73 against US dollar in early trade
items.summary: The rupee edged up by 1 paisa to 90.73 against the US dollar in early trade on Tuesday, supported by falling global crude oil prices. However, a stronger dollar and foreign institutional investor outflows limited the local unit's gains. The rupee had settled lower on Monday, with suspected RBI intervention preventing it from crossing 91.

items.title: Sensex down 230 pts, Nifty loses 100 pts in early trade as markets open on cautious note amid US-Iran tensions
items.summary: The broader market indices on the NSE also showed weakness. The Nifty 100 index declined by 0.26 per cent, while the Nifty Midcap 100 fell by 0.18 per cent

items.title: Global Market | Asia’s bond rally continues as global funds hunt for stability
items.summary: Foreign inflows into Asian local currency bonds remained steady in January, marking a fourth straight month of buying as improving growth prospects and resilient exports boosted sentiment. South Korea, Thailand and Malaysia led the gains, while India saw sharp outflows after its expected inclusion in a global bond index was deferred.

items.title: Isolated spikes, broader calm: Decoding the first month of India's CPI reset
items.summary: A look at item-level distribution, isolated price spikes, and how the revised basket reshapes state and rural–urban comparisons in the first month of the new series.

items.title: RBI eases ECB rules, lifts borrowing limits to $1 bn from $750 mn earlier
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has updated its External Commercial Borrowings rules. Borrowing limits have been raised, and maturity requirements are now more flexible. These changes aim to support the growing trend of Indian companies raising funds through ECBs. The new norms offer greater ease for businesses seeking foreign capital.

items.title: Salon chain Naturals eyeing 2028 IPO if Reliance stake talks fail, says executive
items.summary: Naturals, a leading Indian salon chain, continues discussions with Reliance for a stake sale. Talks have slowed due to disagreements on deal structure. Naturals plans an IPO by 2028 if the Reliance deal does not materialize. The company is not currently negotiating with other investors. Reliance's entry would complement its beauty retail ventures.

items.title: Earnings recovery to support markets in FY27; private capex, manufacturing top bets: Dikshit Mittal
items.summary: Indian stock markets are poised for a stronger performance in the upcoming financial year. Corporate earnings are expected to accelerate, supported by stable macro fundamentals. Key sectors like private capex, manufacturing, private banks, and consumption are set for growth. The IT sector remains under observation pending clearer earnings visibility. Overall, the outlook for Indian equities is constructive.

items.title: Silver prices decline Rs 4,700/kg, gold extends fall on firm US dollar, thin volumes. What should investors do?
items.summary: Gold and silver futures fell on MCX amid weak global cues, thin Lunar New Year trade and a stronger U.S. dollar. April gold dropped 0.8% to Rs 1,53,550 per 10 gm, while March silver slipped 2% to Rs 2,35,206 per kg, reversing mixed moves seen in the previous session.

items.title: Sensex falls over 200 pts, Nifty tests 25,700 as metal, auto stocks lead decline; IT bucks trend
items.summary: Indian benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex opened lower on Tuesday, impacted by declines in metal and auto stocks. The IT index, however, showed strength, rising over 0.5% to lead sectoral gains. Major laggards included Eternal, Tata Steel, and Reliance Industries, while Asian Paints and Infosys saw upward movement.

items.title: Textile and apparel exports down by 3.75% in January, outlook improves now with India US interim deal
items.summary: The decline was mainly seen across key textile segments. Exports of cotton yarn, fabrics, made-ups, and handloom products fell by 4.15 per cent to $995.58 million in January 2026 from $1,038.69 million in January 2025

items.title: India Inc earnings recovery playing out as expected. 35 stocks to buy after Q3 results
items.summary: India Inc's December quarter earnings season largely met expectations, with brokerages turning constructive on select market pockets. Investors have 35 stocks to consider, highlighted for strong earnings momentum or likely near-term turnarounds. The overall earnings revision trajectory has become more palatable, with upgrades supporting profit growth.

items.title: Embassy Developments shares in focus after entering lifestyle, second-home segment with Alibaug project
items.summary: Embassy Developments Ltd. secured MahaRERA approval for its Embassy Serenity project in Alibaug, marking its entry into the premium second-home market. This 7-acre development, featuring 52 residences and extensive green spaces, boasts a GDV of Rs 400 crore. The launch is slated for this quarter, with possession expected by 2030, amid strong company operating momentum.

items.title: Mutual funds slash stakes in 9 of 10 IT stocks but Rs 4 lakh crore still at play
items.summary: Mutual funds significantly reduced their holdings in nine out of ten major IT stocks in January, driven by concerns that AI will disrupt the traditional outsourcing model. Despite this selling pressure, the sector still holds substantial value, with managers offloading stakes in giants like Infosys and TCS, while showing some interest in Wipro.

items.title: Gold slides below $5,000 as Lunar New Year holiday mutes trade
items.summary: Many banks — including BNP Paribas SA, Deutsche Bank AG and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. — have forecast that prices will resume their upward trend, with the factors that underpinned gold’s steady ascent set to persist

items.title: Dividend alert: Last chance to buy Coal India, HAL, and 6 other stocks today. Details here
items.summary: Investors have a final chance to buy into eight companies before they trade ex-dividend on February 18th. Hindustan Aeronautics, Coal India, MSTC, Natco Pharma, Oil India, ONGC, Bharat Forge, and CMS Info Systems are all distributing interim dividends.

items.title: $56 billion AI scare tests resilience of TCS, Infosys and other Indian IT stocks
items.summary: Indian IT stocks, including TCS and Infosys, faced a $56 billion market hit amid global AI-related concerns. The sell-off tested the sector’s resilience as investors reacted to fears of automation-driven disruptions and changing technology dynamics. Despite short-term volatility, analysts say strong fundamentals and long-term growth prospects could help these companies navigate the turbulence and recover over time.

items.title: GMR Airports among 4 Nifty200 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.summary: On February 16, four stocks from the Nifty200 universe entered the RSI Trending Up scan after gaining over 3%, based on StockEdge data. Their RSI readings moved above the 50 mark from lower levels, indicating improving price momentum and rising buying interest, a technical signal often tracked for potential bullish continuation.

items.title: Texmaco Rail shares jump 10% after bagging two orders worth over Rs 240 crore
items.summary: Texmaco Rail & Engineering shares saw a significant jump. The company announced it secured two new orders totaling over Rs 242 crore. One order is from Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation for signalling systems. Another is from South Western Railway for overhead equipment maintenance. These wins expand the company's railway electrification services portfolio.

items.title: Cochin Shipyard shares rally 6% after emerging L1 bidder for Rs 5,000 crore Navy contract
items.summary: Cochin Shipyard's shares climbed significantly after being declared the lowest bidder for a substantial Rs 5,000 crore defence contract. The company is set to construct five Next Generation Survey Vessels for the Indian Navy, marking a major milestone. While the formal contract award awaits procedural completion, this development signals a significant potential order for the state-owned shipbuilder.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | India’s unemployment edges up—but job quality is the real challenge
items.summary: India’s unemployment rate rose in January, as both PLFS and CMIE data shows. But in an economy marked by informal work and weak productivity, the joblessness count matters less than the quality of jobs. On this score, ‘developed economy’ status seems very far away.

items.title: Amazon lauds new labour codes, says to scale up India e-commerce exports
items.summary: The company, which pledged to help create 1 million jobs in India by 2030, welcomed the budget move to scrap the  ₹10 lakh courier export cap and said it will back Indian sellers’ global expansion.

items.title: India is set to cater to global shipbuilding demand: Sarbananda Sonowal
items.summary: Union ports minister Sarbananda Sonowal tells Mint that Indian shipbuilders, through global tie-ups, will receive more orders to develop large ships that were never manufactured in India before.&nbsp;

items.title: Gold, silver import surge pushes India’s January trade deficit to 3-month high of $34.68 billion
items.summary: Surging gold and silver imports widened India’s January trade deficit to $34.68 billion. Imports jumped 19% while exports barely grew, with services offering limited relief amid weak global demand.

items.title: Banks ramp up bad loan sales to ARCs in December quarter, retail NPAs at Rs 24,814 crore
items.summary: Industry data up to December 2025 showed that banks sold Rs 24,814 crore retail non-performing assets (NPAs) to asset reconstruction companies (ARC). That compares with Rs 9,093 crore of retail bad loans sold up to September.

items.summary: Who is Tom Pritzker? The heir to the Hyatt Hotels fortune has stepped down as executive chairman, citing regret over his association with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, as newly released files reveal years of post-2008 contact.

items.summary: Travellers can load the wallet using various payment methods and make transactions by scanning UPI QR codes via the PPI-UPI application

items.summary: The rise in reward-point redemption frequency, even as per-transaction ticket sizes have moderated, suggests points are increasingly being used for regular expenses rather than saved for indulgences.

items.title: High demand for domestic AI infra, Neysa AI CEO says
items.summary: The firm has just raised $600 million from Blackrock, and seeks to raise more, for procuring and running GPUs in India for enterprise clients looking for locally deployed AI.

items.title: Landmark Greenwashing Case Against Gas Producer Santos Dismissed
items.summary: A judge dismissed a long-running legal challenge against Santos Ltd., which had accused the Australian oil and gas producer of misleading investors over its climate strategy.

items.title: BHP Profit Climbs as Copper Offsets China Drag on Iron Ore
items.summary: BHP Group’s earnings for the six months to the end of December rose by more than a fifth thanks to a surge in copper prices, even as plateauing demand in China weighed on its iron ore and steelmaking coal businesses.

items.title: Unemployment in India rises slightly to 5% in January: Government survey
items.summary: The UR (unemployment rate) or joblessness recorded a marginal increase in January in both rural and urban areas, showed the latest Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS)

items.summary: An upscale municipality in Peru’s capital Lima temporarily shuttered over a dozen commercial spaces controlled by one of the country’s top conglomerates, igniting an unlikely battle between the company and a local mayor.

Tit for TAT: Lenders seek reset of compensation rules on ATM fraud
items.summary: Banks are flagging a new ATM fraud to the Reserve Bank of India.  This power-off fraud tricks systems into dispensing cash during withdrawals.  Banks want clearer rules to avoid paying for these fraudulent transactions.  Existing compensation guidelines are being exploited.  This issue is causing significant disputes and financial losses for banks across India.

items.title: Govt extends bid deadline for small oil blocks
items.summary: The government has extended the bid submission deadline for the discovered small fields round. This is the fourth such auction. The new deadline is March 18. This process offers 55 discoveries across nine contract areas. Small discoveries previously deemed unviable are now available under attractive terms. This aims to boost exploration and production.

items.title: ET Graphics: Active buyers go for premium homes
items.summary: The shift suggests the current housing cycle is being driven less by entry-level buyers and more by upgrade purchases. Sales in the Rs 50 lakh-Rs 1 crore category also dropped 8%, suggesting affordability constraints are affecting both lower and mid-income purchasers rather than the housing market as a whole.

items.title: ET Now GBS 2026: AI can cut healthcare costs and bridge talent gap, say industry leaders
items.summary: Industry leaders emphasized the need for academia and industry collaboration to equip India's youth for AI-centric jobs. AI is poised to significantly reduce healthcare costs and bridge the talent gap, enabling remote medical expertise and improving diagnostic efficiency.  This technological revolution presents a substantial opportunity for India's demographic dividend.

items.title: 'Gap between capital value growth and rental gains widens in housing market'
items.summary: India's rental housing market is adjusting. Property prices rose, but rental demand dipped. Rental yields are stable across major cities. Tenant preference leans towards mid-sized, semi-furnished homes. Competition is high for affordable rentals. The market is becoming more balanced and discerning.

items.title: Serials lose the plot as they make it to the big screen
items.summary: This September, Excel Entertainment plans to issue the film adaptation of its web series 'Mirzapur, titled Mirzapur: The Movie'. A challenging aspect of film adaptations of successful IPs of TV and streaming platforms is they appear like extended versions of original medium of storytelling, producers say.

items.title: Indian pharma may take AI pill to cut time and costs in drug R&D
items.summary: Indian pharmaceutical giants Sun Pharma and Glenmark are embracing Artificial Intelligence to speed up new drug creation. This technology promises to cut development times and costs. Global investment in AI for drug discovery is rapidly increasing. Companies are looking to AI for expertise and efficiency. This innovation is set to transform drug research and development cycles.

items.title: Jindal Power, Vedanta and Havells among 22 bidders for Gupta Power
items.summary: Jindal Power, Vedanta, and Havells India are among 22 potential bidders for debt-laden Gupta Power Infrastructure, which faces insolvency proceedings with admitted claims of ₹4,240 crore. Other interested parties include UltraTech Cement and Torrent Electricals. The company manufactures cables, wire rods, and conductors.

items.title: Rising middle class, talent make India a good place to invest in: Bernard Mensah, President of International, Bank of America
items.summary: Bank of America's Bernard Mensah sees India as a prime investment destination, citing its growing middle class, strong institutions, and reformist government. The bank is increasing its India limits, anticipating more M&A activity fueled by regulatory liberalization and a focus on supply chain resilience. Despite geopolitical risks, Mensah believes capitalism's core architecture remains intact.

items.title: In God they trust: Realtors make a beeline for temple towns
items.summary: Developers are investing in temple towns like Ayodhya and Vrindavan. Govt initiatives are boosting religious tourism. This growth is expected to create demand for hotels, retail spaces, and residential properties. Experts anticipate significant development in these spiritual hubs over the coming years. New hotel rooms are projected, and a ripple effect is expected across various real estate sectors.

items.title: Retail set to soar, but firms have a fight on their hands
items.summary: India's retail market is set for massive growth by 2035.  However, retailers must adapt.  Consumers are more selective, demanding convenience and personalization.  Store expansion and discounts are no longer enough.  Technology, especially AI, will be crucial for future success.  Retailers need clear strategies to focus on specific customer segments and leverage AI for growth.

items.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman to push biopharma, semiconductor missions in Norway
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is in Oslo to boost India's bio-pharma and semiconductor sectors. She will meet Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store and discuss capital investments with industry leaders. Sitharaman will also highlight India's Biopharma SHAKTI plan and semiconductor missions. Earlier, she attended the Munich Security Conference, emphasizing economic stability's link to global security.

items.title: Trent is now focusing more on smaller towns: CEO
items.summary: Trent is focusing its expansion on smaller towns. The company is opening many new stores in tier 3 and tier 4 cities. This strategy aims to tap into the growing fashion adoption by young customers in these areas. Trent believes these smaller markets will become very attractive in the coming years. The company is confident in this new growth direction.

items.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 5% in January, higher rise for females
items.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in January, reaching 5%. Joblessness rose more significantly for women compared to men. Rural unemployment edged up, while urban unemployment also increased. The labour force participation rate experienced a minor dip. Youth unemployment also saw a rise, primarily driven by female joblessness.

items.title: NGT green signal for Nicobar Port; notes safeguards
items.summary: In a significant decision, the National Green Tribunal has green-lighted the ambitious Great Nicobar mega infrastructure project. After thorough inspection, the tribunal determined that the environmental clearances come with robust protective measures. It underlined the project's vital role in regional development.

items.title: Telcos want net neutrality rules updated for 5G era
items.summary: Telecom operators such as Reliance Jio have submitted comments concerning net neutrality to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (Trai), asking the regulator to update the norms that will support slicing for tariff products such as a defined upload speed slice and low latency gaming slice.

items.title: Tata Sons brings in former civil aviation secretary as Air India faces regulatory hurdles
items.summary: Tata Sons has appointed former civil aviation secretary Pradeep Singh Kharola as an advisor for its aviation business. This move aims to bolster Air India's turnaround efforts. Kharola's expertise will be crucial in managing government communications. Air India faces significant regulatory scrutiny and operational challenges. The airline is also undergoing a leadership transition.

items.title: 29 vitamin-mineral FDC drugs under review for possible ban over 'irrational' tag
items.summary: A looming ban on twenty-nine vitamin and mineral combination drugs has sparked a heated debate. Initially flagged as irrational by an expert panel in 2015, these products are now being re-evaluated by a specialized sub-committee. Before any final ruling, the companies will be given a chance to defend their products.

items.title: Wholesale inflation touches 10-month high of 1.8% in January
items.summary: India's wholesale inflation reached a 10-month peak of 1.81 percent in January. This rise was fueled by higher costs for food, non-food articles, and manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw its first reading under a new series. Economists noted a gradual increase in inflation since October 2025. The core WPI segment showed a significant jump.

items.title: Govt plans ‘Champion CPSEs’ for Viksit Bharat by 2047, NITI Aayog roadmap soon
items.summary: India is preparing to create 'champion' public sector companies. These firms will boost economic growth and technology. The goal is to help India become a developed nation by 2047. These companies will get more freedom in decisions and talent hiring. They will use new technologies for better performance.

items.title: India-US trade deal: Trade team heading to Washington next week for legal pact
items.summary: India's chief negotiator Darpan Jain will lead a delegation to Washington next week to finalize the legal agreement for the India-US trade deal, aiming for a March signing. The visit follows the finalization of an interim trade agreement framework, with virtual talks ongoing to translate contours into a legal pact.

items.title: Air India to strengthen network on key international routes
items.summary: Air India is boosting international travel options. New cabin interiors and more flights are coming to key routes. Passengers can expect enhanced comfort on flights to Toronto, Seoul, Shanghai, Tokyo, and London. New aircraft deliveries will further improve the travel experience. This expansion aims to offer more seats and better service across its network.

items.title: Mumbai airport: Airlines' body IATA flags concern over impact of temporary suspension of cargo operations
items.summary: Global airlines body IATA is worried about Mumbai airport's plan to stop cargo flights from August 2026. The Adani group-operated airport intends to upgrade its infrastructure. IATA has sought clarification from the airport operator but has not yet received a response. This suspension is planned until May 2027.

items.title: Meerut Metro to become India's fastest, to run at 120 kmph
items.summary: Meerut Metro will soon be India's fastest metro, operating at 120 kmph. This new service connects Meerut South to Modipuram over 21 km in about 30 minutes. It will run on the same tracks as Namo Bharat trains, creating an integrated transport system. Modern trains will offer energy efficiency and advanced technology.

items.title: IndiGo extends cancellation of Tbilisi, Almaty, Baku, Tashkent flights till Mar 28
items.summary: IndiGo has extended flight cancellations to Tbilisi, Almaty, Baku, and Tashkent until March 28, 2026, citing ongoing developments around Iran and its airspace. This decision impacts long-haul flights as both IndiGo and Air India are avoiding Iranian airspace.
